page.title: 01AREA OF MARTON-CUM-GRAFTON
page.content: Situated at the edge of the Vale of Yorkm this block includes two small villages known as Marton and Grafton. The surrounding area is farmland and apart from one notable farm the fields have been cultivated. The exception concerns a farm with a stock of some 200 cows and their fields are used for pasture. The small post office come general shop situated in Grafton is run bu "locals" and it is here that the hub of the village exists for the shop seems to supply all the needs of the village from mousetraps to sacks of corn. Local entertainment is provided by the running of bingo and whist drives and W.I. meetings in the village hall.
